ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Different aspects of pathogenesis and critical thinking.

I think the biggest thing is that this course definitely improved my paper-reading skills - the weekly summaries especially helped my ability to pick out and understand the most important information in a paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: we can get access to different areas in microbial pathogenesis, especially ecology and structure, which are somewhat unfamiliar to me. Weaknesses: the knowledge can be more organized, and discussion can be more engaging.

I really liked the format of the course, and how we alternated between lectures and paper discussions. It was great being able to learn a little about all the professors' research interests. I found the idea that the grade was almost entirely based on the final exam a little daunting, especially when we had no feedback on our paper summaries throughout the semester. Overall, I really enjoyed the course - my only (small) issue was that the reading assignments were rarely distributed as far in advance of the deadline as we were told they would be at the beginning of the semester (so that we often only had one day to get it done) - but it was still do-able.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
